str2: Of Hebrew origin; Joannes, the name of four Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and krino; to conclude for oneself, i.e. to respond; by Hebraism to begin to speak.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: Lit: I dip, submerge, but specifically of ceremonial dipping; I baptize.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Water. And genitive case, hudatos, etc. From the base of huetos; water literally or figuratively.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Strong (originally and generally of physical strength); mighty, powerful, vehement, sure. From ischus; forcible.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To come, go.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Perhaps from the same as hama; a strap, i.e. the tie or the lash.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.
A sandal; anything bound under. From hupodeo; something bound under the feet, i.e. A shoe or sandal.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
From hiko; competent, i.e. Ample or fit.
A primary verb; to 'loosen'.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Lit: I dip, submerge, but specifically of ceremonial dipping; I baptize.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.
Wind, breath, spirit.
And, even, also, namely.
Fire; the heat of the sun, lightning; fig: strife, trials; the eternal fire. A primary word; 'fire'.
